title: Bare hands
data:
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [ ]## Contents* [1 Bare hands skill](#Bare_hands_skill)

* [2 Damage calculation](#Damage_calculation)

* [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

* [4 History](#History)

* [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 SporkHack](#SporkHack)

* [6 References](#References) |

**Bare hands** is a [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* that is used when attacking enemies while not [wielding](/wiki/Wield "Wield") anything. Every [role](/wiki/Role "Role") except for the [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk") and [Samurai](/wiki/Samurai "Samurai") has this skill - the Monk and Samurai instead possess the [martial arts](/wiki/Martial_arts "Martial arts") skill.

## Bare hands skill

| Bare hands |                                                                                                                                                           |
| ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max        | [Role](/wiki/Role "Role")                                                                                                                                 |
| Basic      | - [Healer](/wiki/Healer "Healer"), [Priest](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger"), [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard")                      |
| Skilled    | * [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist")                                                                                                                      |
| Expert     | - [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist"), [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue"), [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") |
| Master     | * [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), [Caveman](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman")                                                                            |

Fighting while not wielding anything naturally trains the bare hands skill. [Barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian") and [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople") can reach *Master* in barehanded combat, and so start with *Basic* skill, while all other roles start as *Unskilled*.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) No role can advance to *Grand Master* in bare hands.

## Damage calculation

Attacks using the hero's bare hands (or **bare [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves")** if wearing them) have a base damage of 1d2 against both [small](/wiki/Small "Small") and [large](/wiki/Large "Large") monsters, with the exception of [shades](/wiki/Shade "Shade") (who take 0 base damage).[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) These attacks gain damage bonuses for [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength"), as well as skill-based damage bonuses: +1 for Basic or Skilled level, or +2 for Expert or Master level, with an average of is (1 + (2 + x))/2 where *x* is the applied bonus.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Skill training and skill-based damage bonuses only apply for hits with more than 1 base damage. In addition, bare-handed attacks with at least Basic skill have a small chance of performing a [staggering blow](/wiki/Staggering_blow "Staggering blow") on hit.

Blessed gloves grant a +1d4 damage bonus to bare-handed attacks against [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead") and [major demons](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon"). Wearing a [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") with the randomized appearance of a [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver") ring *without* wearing gloves over them grants a +1d20 damage bonus to bare-handed attacks against silver-haters (which is not applied twice if wearing two silver rings).[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

Below is a table that outlines damage and to-hit bonuses for skill in barehanded combat, along with the average damage - not:

|           | + to-hit | + damage | average damage |
| --------- | -------- | -------- | -------------- |
| Unskilled | +1       | +0       | 1.5            |
| Basic     | +1       | +1       | 2              |
| Skilled   | +2       | +1       | 2              |
| Expert    | +2       | +2       | 2.5            |
| Master    | +3       | +2       | 2.5            |

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Per [commit c1c515af](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/c1c515af9f2528b3d26a93fc8b708454a3153ed1), skill-based damage bonus is applied regardless of base damage, though hits that roll base damage of 1 will still not train the skill.

Per [commit 60c19568](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/60c1956850179f4860e59957138154ec65255998), bare-handed combat has a skill dependent chance of performing a second attack automatically: this has a 1⁄5 chance of occurring for each skill level above Basic, e.g. 2⁄5 for Skilled or 4⁄5 for Grand Master. Each hit only gains a 3⁄4 bonus to strength when attacking twice, though both attacks landing results in a net 3⁄2 strength bonus.

## Strategy

Barehanded combat can be serviceable for certain starting heroes until they find a proper weapon, and may even be viable in certain situations where the hero is either desperate or does not want to risk degrading of particular weapons (e.g. fighting a [rust monster](/wiki/Rust_monster "Rust monster")). Generally though, the skill is rarely worth enhancing for such marginal benefits, and any [ranged attack](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") options may be more favorable.

For [weaponless](/wiki/Weaponless "Weaponless") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct"), roles with martial arts are preferred due to superious Bare-handed attacks do not break the [never hit with a wielded weapon](/wiki/Never_hit_with_a_wielded_weapon "Never hit with a wielded weapon") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct"). However, a role with [martial arts](/wiki/Martial_arts "Martial arts") is much more suitable for this conduct, since the skill is superior for unarmed combat overall.

## History

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), there is no [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") bonus for this skill.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Verify the exact commit(s) that remedied this and clarify when they were implemented."*

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)") heroes can put monsters to sleep by attacking in barehanded combat, which can be deceptively powerful against certain monsters that lack [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance").

### SporkHack

In [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), advancing the skill grants to-hit bonuses.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/weapon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1634](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/weapon.c#L1634)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 704](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/uhitm.c#L704)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/weapon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1452](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/weapon.c#L1452)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/weapon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 353](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/weapon.c#L353): *function special\_dmgval*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [doc/fixes36.0 in NetHack 3.6.7, line 20](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/doc/fixes36.0#L20)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Bare hands

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Contents

  • 1 Bare hands skill
  • 2 Damage calculation
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SLASH'EM
    • 5.2 SporkHack
  • 6 References

Bare hands is a skill in NetHack that is used when attacking enemies while not wielding anything. Every role except for the Monk and Samurai has this skill - the Monk and Samurai instead possess the martial arts skill.

Bare hands skill

Bare hands
Max Role
Basic
  • Healer, Priest, Ranger, Wizard
Skilled
  • Tourist
Expert
  • Archeologist, Knight, Rogue, Valkyrie
Master
  • Barbarian, Caveman

Fighting while not wielding anything naturally trains the bare hands skill. Barbarians and Cavepeople can reach Master in barehanded combat, and so start with Basic skill, while all other roles start as Unskilled.[1] No role can advance to Grand Master in bare hands.

Damage calculation

Attacks using the hero's bare hands (or bare gloves if wearing them) have a base damage of 1d2 against both small and large monsters, with the exception of shades (who take 0 base damage).[2] These attacks gain damage bonuses for strength, as well as skill-based damage bonuses: +1 for Basic or Skilled level, or +2 for Expert or Master level, with an average of is (1 + (2 + x))/2 where x is the applied bonus.[3] Skill training and skill-based damage bonuses only apply for hits with more than 1 base damage. In addition, bare-handed attacks with at least Basic skill have a small chance of performing a staggering blow on hit.

Blessed gloves grant a +1d4 damage bonus to bare-handed attacks against undead and major demons. Wearing a ring with the randomized appearance of a silver ring without wearing gloves over them grants a +1d20 damage bonus to bare-handed attacks against silver-haters (which is not applied twice if wearing two silver rings).[4]

Below is a table that outlines damage and to-hit bonuses for skill in barehanded combat, along with the average damage - not:

  + to-hit + damage average damage
Unskilled +1 +0 1.5
Basic +1 +1 2
Skilled +2 +1 2
Expert +2 +2 2.5
Master +3 +2 2.5

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Per commit c1c515af, skill-based damage bonus is applied regardless of base damage, though hits that roll base damage of 1 will still not train the skill.

Per commit 60c19568, bare-handed combat has a skill dependent chance of performing a second attack automatically: this has a 1⁄5 chance of occurring for each skill level above Basic, e.g. 2⁄5 for Skilled or 4⁄5 for Grand Master. Each hit only gains a 3⁄4 bonus to strength when attacking twice, though both attacks landing results in a net 3⁄2 strength bonus.

Strategy

Barehanded combat can be serviceable for certain starting heroes until they find a proper weapon, and may even be viable in certain situations where the hero is either desperate or does not want to risk degrading of particular weapons (e.g. fighting a rust monster). Generally though, the skill is rarely worth enhancing for such marginal benefits, and any ranged attack options may be more favorable.

For weaponless conduct, roles with martial arts are preferred due to superious Bare-handed attacks do not break the never hit with a wielded weapon conduct. However, a role with martial arts is much more suitable for this conduct, since the skill is superior for unarmed combat overall.

History

In NetHack 3.4.3, there is no to-hit bonus for this skill.[5]

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Verify the exact commit(s) that remedied this and clarify when they were implemented."

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, drow heroes can put monsters to sleep by attacking in barehanded combat, which can be deceptively powerful against certain monsters that lack sleep resistance.

SporkHack

In SporkHack, advancing the skill grants to-hit bonuses.

References

  1. ↑ src/weapon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1634
  2. ↑ src/uhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 704
  3. ↑ src/weapon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1452
  4. ↑ src/weapon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 353: function special_dmgval
  5. ↑ doc/fixes36.0 in NetHack 3.6.7, line 20

rawPage:
{{tocright}}
'''Bare hands''' is a [[skill]] in ''[[NetHack]]'' that is used when attacking enemies while not [[wield]]ing anything. Every [[role]] except for the [[Monk]] and [[Samurai]] has this skill - the Monk and Samurai instead possess the [[martial arts]] skill.

==Bare hands skill==
{{bare hands skill table}}
Fighting while not wielding anything naturally trains the bare hands skill. [[Barbarian]]s and [[Cavepeople]] can reach ''Master'' in barehanded combat, and so start with ''Basic'' skill, while all other roles start as ''Unskilled''.{{refsrc|src/weapon.c|1634|nethack=3.6.7}} No role can advance to ''Grand Master'' in bare hands.

==Damage calculation==
Attacks using the hero's bare hands (or '''bare [[gloves]]''' if wearing them) have a base damage of 1d2 against both [[small]] and [[large]] monsters, with the exception of [[shade]]s (who take 0 base damage).{{refsrc|src/uhitm.c|704|nethack=3.6.7}} These attacks gain damage bonuses for [[strength]], as well as skill-based damage bonuses: +1 for Basic or Skilled level, or +2 for Expert or Master level, with an average of is (1 + (2 + x))/2 where ''x'' is the applied bonus.{{refsrc|src/weapon.c|1452|nethack=3.6.7}} Skill training and skill-based damage bonuses only apply for hits with more than 1 base damage. In addition, bare-handed attacks with at least Basic skill have a small chance of performing a [[staggering blow]] on hit.

Blessed gloves grant a +1d4 damage bonus to bare-handed attacks against [[undead]] and [[major demon]]s. Wearing a [[ring]] with the randomized appearance of a [[silver]] ring ''without'' wearing gloves over them grants a +1d20 damage bonus to bare-handed attacks against silver-haters (which is not applied twice if wearing two silver rings).{{refsrc|src/weapon.c|353|nethack=3.6.7|comment=function special_dmgval}}
 
Below is a table that outlines damage and to-hit bonuses for skill in barehanded combat, along with the average damage - not:

{| class="prettytable" 
!  
! + to-hit
! + damage
! average damage
|-
| Unskilled || +1 || +0  || 1.5
|-
| Basic || +1 || +1 || 2
|-
| Skilled || +2 || +1 || 2
|-
| Expert || +2 || +2 || 2.5
|-
| Master || +3 || +2 || 2.5
|}

{{upcoming|NetHack 3.7.0|Per {{commit|c1c515af9f2528b3d26a93fc8b708454a3153ed1}}, skill-based damage bonus is applied regardless of base damage, though hits that roll base damage of 1 will still not train the skill.

Per {{commit|60c1956850179f4860e59957138154ec65255998}}, bare-handed combat has a skill dependent chance of performing a second attack automatically: this has a {{frac|5}} chance of occurring for each skill level above Basic, e.g. {{frac|2|5}} for Skilled or {{frac|4|5}} for Grand Master. Each hit only gains a {{frac|3|4}} bonus to strength when attacking twice, though both attacks landing results in a net {{frac|3|2}} strength bonus.}}

==Strategy==
Barehanded combat can be serviceable for certain starting heroes until they find a proper weapon, and may even be viable in certain situations where the hero is either desperate or does not want to risk degrading of particular weapons (e.g. fighting a [[rust monster]]). Generally though, the skill is rarely worth enhancing for such marginal benefits, and any [[ranged attack]] options may be more favorable.

For [[weaponless]] [[conduct]], roles with martial arts are preferred due to superious Bare-handed attacks do not break the [[never hit with a wielded weapon]] [[conduct]]. However, a role with [[martial arts]] is much more suitable for this conduct, since the skill is superior for unarmed combat overall.

==History==
In [[NetHack 3.4.3]], there is no [[to-hit]] bonus for this skill.{{refsrc|doc/fixes36.0|20|nethack=3.6.7}}

{{todo|Verify the exact commit(s) that remedied this and clarify when they were implemented.}}

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], [[Drow (starting race)|drow]] heroes can put monsters to sleep by attacking in barehanded combat, which can be deceptively powerful against certain monsters that lack [[sleep resistance]].

===SporkHack===
In [[SporkHack]], advancing the skill grants to-hit bonuses.
